body.p: Which of the following samples is an appropriate random sample for testing this hypothesis?

multiple_choice.choice: A random sample of 100 county residents
A random sample of 100 registered voters who voted in the last statewide election
A random sample of 100 registered voters from the county
A random sample of 100 registered voters from the largest city in the county

response.name: county residents
response.feedback: Incorrect. The sample needs to be a subset of the population of interest. Since some residents may be too young to vote or are not registered to vote, this sample will contain people who are not in the population. Carefully reread the definition of the parameter p to identify the population about which we are testing a hypothesis. Try again.

response.name: statewide election
response.feedback: Incorrect. The sample needs to be a subset of the population of interest. This sample will contain people who are not in the population. Carefully reread the definition of the parameter p to identify the population about which we are testing a hypothesis.

response.name: registered county residents
response.feedback: Correct. The population of interest is “registered voters in the county.” Here we are taking a random sample from the population.

response.name: largest city
response.feedback: Incorrect. This is a random sample drawn from a segment of the population of interest. But registered voters in the largest city in the county may not accurately represent the opinions of the county as a whole. Rural voters may vote differently on bond measures than urban voters. The sample must be randomly drawn from the population as a whole.

part.hint: Ideally, the sample is a random sample from the population of interest.
